commit.title: [engine] Improve backtraces of tactics.
commit.message:
[engine] Improve backtraces of tactics.

We embed proper backtrace information in the error part of the
monad. Even if a bit artisanal, the results seem to improve. For
example, for the following script:

```coq
Lemma u n : n + 0 = n.
rewrite plus_O_n.
```

we get in `master`:
```
Error:
Found no subterm matching "0 + ?M160" in the current goal.

Raised at file "pretyping/unification.ml", line 1806, characters 14-73
Called from file "pretyping/unification.ml", line 1908, characters 10-46
Called from file "pretyping/unification.ml", line 1927, characters 22-72
Called from file "pretyping/unification.ml", line 1999, characters 7-49
Re-raised at file "pretyping/unification.ml", line 2000, characters 59-66
Called from file "proofs/clenv.ml", line 255, characters 12-58
Called from file "proofs/clenvtac.ml", line 110, characters 16-53
Called from file "engine/proofview.ml", line 1145, characters 40-46
Called from file "engine/proofview.ml", line 1150, characters 10-34
Re-raised at file "engine/proofview.ml", line 239, characters 4-38
Called from file "proofs/proof.ml", line 394, characters 4-30
Called from file "proofs/pfedit.ml", line 129, characters 28-67
Called from file "g_ltac.mlg", line 391, characters 6-82
Called from file "proofs/proof_global.ml", line 170, characters 24-36
Called from file "g_ltac.mlg", line 386, characters 15-536
Called from file "g_ltac.mlg", line 447, characters 4-26
Called from file "vernac/vernacinterp.ml", line 87, characters 4-18
```

vs in 8.9:
```
Error:
Found no subterm matching "0 + ?M160" in the current goal.

raise @ file "clib/exninfo.ml", line 65, characters 2-15
frame @ file "proofs/proof.ml", line 396, characters 4-30
frame @ file "proofs/pfedit.ml", line 129, characters 28-67
raise @ unknown
frame @ file "plugins/ltac/g_ltac.ml4", line 383, characters 6-82
frame @ file "proofs/proof_global.ml", line 171, characters 24-36
frame @ file "plugins/ltac/g_ltac.ml4", line 378, characters 15-536
frame @ file "plugins/ltac/g_ltac.ml4", line 425, characters 4-26
frame @ file "vernac/vernacinterp.ml", line 87, characters 4-18
```

which clearly makes no sense.

[engine] Improve backtraces of tactics.

We embed proper backtrace information in the error part of the
monad. Even if a bit artisanal, the results seem to improve. For
example, for the following script:

```coq
Lemma u n : n + 0 = n.
rewrite plus_O_n.
```

we get in `master`:
```
Error:
Found no subterm matching "0 + ?M160" in the current goal.

Raised at file "pretyping/unification.ml", line 1806, characters 14-73
Called from file "pretyping/unification.ml", line 1908, characters 10-46
Called from file "pretyping/unification.ml", line 1927, characters 22-72
Called from file "pretyping/unification.ml", line 1999, characters 7-49
Re-raised at file "pretyping/unification.ml", line 2000, characters 59-66
Called from file "proofs/clenv.ml", line 255, characters 12-58
Called from file "proofs/clenvtac.ml", line 110, characters 16-53
Called from file "engine/proofview.ml", line 1145, characters 40-46
Called from file "engine/proofview.ml", line 1150, characters 10-34
Re-raised at file "engine/proofview.ml", line 239, characters 4-38
Called from file "proofs/proof.ml", line 394, characters 4-30
Called from file "proofs/pfedit.ml", line 129, characters 28-67
Called from file "g_ltac.mlg", line 391, characters 6-82
Called from file "proofs/proof_global.ml", line 170, characters 24-36
Called from file "g_ltac.mlg", line 386, characters 15-536
Called from file "g_ltac.mlg", line 447, characters 4-26
Called from file "vernac/vernacinterp.ml", line 87, characters 4-18
```

vs in 8.9:
```
Error:
Found no subterm matching "0 + ?M160" in the current goal.

raise @ file "clib/exninfo.ml", line 65, characters 2-15
frame @ file "proofs/proof.ml", line 396, characters 4-30
frame @ file "proofs/pfedit.ml", line 129, characters 28-67
raise @ unknown
frame @ file "plugins/ltac/g_ltac.ml4", line 383, characters 6-82
frame @ file "proofs/proof_global.ml", line 171, characters 24-36
frame @ file "plugins/ltac/g_ltac.ml4", line 378, characters 15-536
frame @ file "plugins/ltac/g_ltac.ml4", line 425, characters 4-26
frame @ file "vernac/vernacinterp.ml", line 87, characters 4-18
```

which clearly makes no sense.
